definition: to make a copy/to plagiarize/to search and seize/to raid/to grab/to go off with/to take a shortcut/to make a turning move/to fold one's arms
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)

sentences.english: Police raided the factory that was employing child laborers.
sentences.chinese: 警方抄查那個僱用童工的工廠。

sentences.english: The company was knocked off yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 該公司昨天被突然抄查了。

sentences.english: The police knocked the gambling joint over yesterday.

definition: to take inventory of and confiscate a criminal's possessions/to search and confiscate (forbidden items)/to raid
to search a house and confiscate possessions
to investigate thoroughly/to carefully inspect/to verify/to ferret out (undesirable elements)
to execute the whole family and confiscate their property
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
to warn/to blame/to rebuke/also written 申斥
